topic.title: Chapter 3
topic.shortdesc: A new diesel locomotivetrain is brought to the railway company to replace Charlie.

section.title: New Train in Town

image.alt: picture of a shiny, modern red train

section.p: One day, when Engineer Bob returned to St. Louis, they found a new diesel trainlocomotive in Charlie's berth. And what a diesel trainlocomotive it was! Five thousand horsepower! Stainless steel connectorscouplers! Traction motors from the Utica Engine Works in Utica, New York! And sitting on top, behind the generator, were three bright yellow radiator cooling fans.
"What is this?" Engineer Bob asked in a worried voice, but Charlie only sang his song in his smallest, gruffest voice:

section.title: Some Bad News

fig.title: Mr. Briggs tells Engineer Bob the news

image.alt: picture of the new train in a berth behind Engineer Bob and Mr. Briggs

section.p: Mr. Briggs, the roundhouse manager, came over.
"That is a beautiful diesel train," said Engineer Bob, "but you will have to move it out of Charlie's berth, Mr. Briggs. That's where Charlie goes."
"That is a beautiful diesel locomotive," said Engineer Bob, "but you will have to move it out of Charlie's berth, Mr. Briggs. Charlie needs a lube job this very afternoon."

"Not anymore, Engineer Bob," said Mr. Briggs sadly. "This is his replacement—a brand-new Burlington Zephyr diesel train. Once, Charlie was the best train in the world, but now he is old and his boiler leaks. I am afraid the time has come for Charlie to retire."

"Charlie won't be needing any more lube jobs, Engineer Bob," said Mr. Briggs sadly. "This is his replacement—a brand-new Burlington Zephyr diesel loco. Once, Charlie was the best locomotive in the world, but now he is old and his boiler leaks. I am afraid the time has come for Charlie to retire."
